thread.title: Football: Roland Puts On Offensive Show To Top Heavener 60-13
thread.title_full: Football: Roland Puts On Offensive Show To Top Heavener 60-13

title: Football: Roland Puts On Offensive Show To Top Heavener 60-13
text:
Football: Roland Puts On Offensive Show To Top Heavener 60-13 Times Record Staff 
Roland scored touchdowns on its first three offensive plays of the game, amassing 34 points in the first quarter, en route to a 60-13 win over Heavener on Thursday in Roland. 
Quarterback Manuel Bunch hooked up on a 10-yard pass to wide receiver Gavin Lynch on the Rangers’ first play from scrimmage. 
The Bunch to Lynch connection went to work again on the Rangers’ very next play from scrimmage, a 22-yard connection, then again on the next play after that, this time covering 64 yards at the 7:53 mark of the first quarter. 
The next Roland score took a little longer. Bunch once again linked up with Lynch on a 12-yard pass three plays into the Rangers’ fourth possession. By the time the dust had cleared on the offensive flurry, Roland led 34-0 at the end of the first quarter. 
Lynch wasn’t done yet. He took the kickoff to open the second half and raced 80 yards for a score, boosting the Roland lead to 54-0. 
For the game, Lynch caught 6 passes for 149 yards and four scores and ran a kickoff back for a score. 
Bunch was 9-11 passing for 215 yards and five scores and ran once for 15 yards and another TD. 
Roland (6-1, 3-0) gets back in action next Friday at Stigler. 
Heavener (2-5, 1-3) hosts Spiro on Friday.
